title: Vicarious Kiss
description:
Nora Card sponsored by SiliconCarbide! Suggested by Storymaker2!

Color version of this sketch, expanded.

This should have been posted a looong time ago, but the sponsor requested the night city background (the Sony Center in Berlin, specifically) and I just couldn't get it right. I retried it maybe 5 or 6 times, over and over, but I think I finally got a result I'm halfway pleased with. The sponsor also requested I do a version with Zen with a leg prosthetic and cane. I used the Shopping for New Parts sketch and also automail from FMA as inspiration.

You can find a big pile of alt versions without text or Natani attached below.

title: Willow Wisp
description:
Old character concept I made a long time ago, drawn again suggested by Winded Cat Productions!


(For those looking for backstory, copied from the comments):

Willow's true essence is the lantern itself. She's an actual Will-o'-the-Wisp, and unavoidably leads travelers to their doom, whether she wants to or not. Her body is that of a lost girl she once befriended and tried to guide safely out of the forest, but it inevitably lead to a tragic end. She grieves the fact that she couldn't save her, nor can she stop taking on her appearance. She's always careful to never let anyone follow her lead now.

title: A Mother's Love
description:
#2 Color vote from March, the most precious love of Lady Nora's past, suggested by Drazgon!

This one was quite the undertaking. I decided to give a full background for the future version of the fey mother, despite it only requiring a tiny sliver for the original sketch. So, consider it a bonus! I also included a full version of the baby dragon version, and attached a speechless version of the combined image as well.

Hera was the first child of Nora, back when Nora was just a young inexperience dragon herself. She loved her daughter more than anything and spent years looking for her after she vanished. She would never learn what happened.

For more info on the fey mother, see here: The Mother

Nora is a shapeshifter, so I'm sure shapely legs are no problem if she wanted them ;D

title: Bedtime Story
description:
Art originally suggested by Dadrobit!


In an alternate timeline, orphaned future-assassins Zen and Natani instead attempt to earn food using a old fishing boat. The inexperienced pups are swept out to sea, eventually landing on the shores of the Basitin Isles. Before the generals can throw them back to certain death, a younger King Adelaide decides to show them mercy - adopting the wolves, to most of the Basitin elite's horror.


[This little story - not from Dadrobit - was just my attempt to explaination how this situation could possibly come about.  ^^ ]

title: Announcing Sunday Sketch Requests!
description:
Starting November, I'll be taking weekly suggestions for sketches! Anyone pledging $10 or more are welcome to add your ideas each week. Please note, I likely will not get to them all. I'll generally be looking for funny or creative suggestions, or just whatever sounds the most fun! Requests for pin-up style sketches or a little sauciness is of course perfectly fine as well. ;)  (No OCs, though. Sorry!)

The resulting sketches will be publicly available for everyone, patron or not, so everyone can enjoy them. Keep that in mind!

Starting next Sunday, and each subsequent Sunday, I will also begin doing Sunday Sketch Streams where I will be drawing the sketches you suggest here!

At the beginning of every month (starting December) I will hold a vote. All the sketches made in the previous month will be put up and the top picks will be made into finished full-color art, which will of course be publicly available as well.

I hope this sounds like fun for you guys! I wanted to give back to all of you who have been so generous. Up until now, you've pledged with no expectation of getting anything in return. I figured with this, those who contribute can now be rewarded. Those who can only contribute a little will still get to join in on the streams. And those that cannot contribute at all still get new sketches out of the deal! A win-win-win for everyone, I think. :)

Let me know what you think! Oh, and for this week, just to get started, anyone can feel free to make suggestions below for next week's stream, if you have any ideas!

title: Petting Lycanroc
description:
A lot of people don't know this, but I was a HUGE Pokemon fan back when it first started coming to the west. To the point where an 11-year-old me once left a note to my future self, to hopefully one day remind him of the passion he once held for the show, once it had stopped running (haha).


Little did I know, new episodes and games would still be coming out two decades later. And truth be told I haven't been keeping up with the show. (sorry, younger me) I pretty much left it behind around Gen II. That being said, I am starting to become interested in seeing what I've been missing out on recently, and the new upcoming release has me intrigued. I plan to dive back in and hopefully rekindle some of those old feelings I once had for my very first fandom obsession.

So, without further ado... here's an inappropriately affectionate Lycanroc. :P

title: Dragon-Girl Wrinry
description:
You may remember this character from years back, here: http://fav.me/d5lb2gk This is an updated version of the design, with my current style. You might also notice she resembles the dragon cultist, Sarah: http://fav.me/d9q3n29 but make no mistake! Wrinry came first!


Here is the story synopsis:

Wrinry is a young dragon cursed into human form. A fact that doesn't really bother her until she realizes that without wings, she can never return to the mountain top she calls home. It's up to her familiar Sivil and some unlikely friends to help her get back and discover why she was cursed in the first place.

This is a short comic series I've had in the back of my mind for a long while, but just haven't had the time to fully realize yet. I still I think it has a lot of potential, though! With some help, maybe it could make for a nice side project.

title: Omnipoll Reminder
description:
Just a reminder, I'll be using the poll from last week ( https://www.patreon.com/posts/submit-sketch-2-80838439 ) for an Omnipoll¹ this week. I'll be posting the poll tomorrow, April 7th. If you already submitted, you don't have to do anything. If you didn't or you want to change your suggestion, do so now! Your submission can always be edited at any time (Er, well, until the Omnipoll goes up. Then it's too late... lol ).

¹ An Omnipoll is one big list of all suggestions that any $5+ Patron can browse and vote on. They usually only happen on months with 4 sketch weeks instead of the usual 3, like this April!

(This reminder post will be removed once the omnipoll goes up)

title: Nora's Comfort
description:
Nora Card sponsored by Drazgon!

Original sketch: https://www.patreon.com/posts/grief-22986454

Expanded quite a bit from the original sketch. This piece was originally worked on earlier in the year. I had it marked as "complete" in my work folder, not realizing it hadn't been finished and posted yet. Whoops! Luckily I was reminded of this and managed to put a lot of finishing touches to the final image.

Hope you like the final result! I enjoy doing emotional scenes like these. Nora isn't always so irreverent. She doesn't like to take life seriously, but even she gets emotional sometimes.

title: The TK Sims - Modern Trio
description:
Bonus color for August, suggested by macer11!

I started learning Blender for the first time earlier this year, and since I have a lot of nostalgia for The Sims, I used this suggestion as an excuse to try and improve at the software. I had to figure out many, many things in order to put this together, including modelling, texturing, lighting, materials, camera setup, etc. It was a fun project! I was able to learn a lot from it.

I uploaded the model to Sketchfab so you can look around for yourself if you'd like: https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/twokinds-modern-trio-apartment-86d857ef058b445880d9883b5dfd1b89 

(I've never uploaded a 3D model before, so hopefully that works.)

All objects in the apartment were modeled by me except for the doors and windows, which were generated from Blender's built-in architectural add-on.

Apartment design originally suggested by Moxolotl!

title: Half-Dragon Meet-Up
description:
Adrakist Flora meets Wrinry, suggested by Skornos! I also included Flora meeting the other half dragon, the Adrakist* Seraphina!

*Adrakist just means dragon worshiper, aka "A drake-ist".

Just to be nit-picky, Wrinry is not an Adrakist. In the series she was planned for long ago, she was simply a dragon cursed into a mostly-human form. But she did inspire Sarah's design in the actual comic.

Final note, most Adrakists don't transform themselves to look like dragons. Most are normal people who just have a great appreciation for the dragons. Sarah is... uniquely passionate in her dragon fixation. An Adrakist Zealot, if you will. Her and the others in the "become dragons" sect are the reason why Adrakists have a reputation for being crazy.

title: Riftwall West Layout
description:
Amelia's Riftwall, suggested by Moxi!

This is technically only half of the whole thing, the rest is on the other side of the river attached by a walk bridge, but since that side was abandoned in the story anyway, I can't be bothered to design two taverns. XD This was already a lot.

This was planned to be the setting of Riftwall, a separate story from a long time ago. There's a couple characters missing: Vivian, who doesn't live in the tavern but in her treehouse next door, and the human, Katie, who was an unofficial guest and would probably end up in one of the guest rooms.

I've attached one of the old concept sketches for the outside from 2014 which shows the full setting, including Vivian's roost and the other tavern.

title: Mike x Evals
description:
How genderbent are they? For once, not at all!


Maybe this is payback for Evals sneaking into fem-Mike's bed on the ship. Or maybe Mike's just revealing his true feelings.

Originally, I intended this sketch blog to just be entirely non-Twokinds related artwork. But I've decided that doesn't really seem necessary. So, I'm going to just put up whatever falls out of my head from now on.

title: Subnautica
description:
Laura playing Subnautica, exploring the underwater sights in a Seamoth, suggested by ThingsAreDiving!

Subnautica is a great game, I recommend it. It is survival crafting, which I'm not usually a fan of, but it's singleplayer and has a complete story with a satisfying end goal and a very pretty environment to explore. It's quite a unique experience in the genre.

title: Hoist the Sails & Objection!
description:
Sketch #1 was a remake of a panel from page 306 requested by MetalAppleSauce!

Sketch #2 (and alt version) was requested by Aello!


Some fans hosted a fanart contest last year and requested that I doodle some quick sketches for those picked as winners. To which I said... ok, sure! It took me a bit longer to get to than I'd thought, but here they are! Just to be clear, I didn't organize the fanart contest, but I looked over all the results and thought everyone's submission looked great. Amazing work to those involved! Thank you :)

A tiger style wedding, suggested by Iago24!

title: Nib Nab 4 - Brutus and Clovis
description:
Nibbly gets away with more clothes, suggested by Storymaker2!


Some people do wonder if Brutus is simply putting on an act. But I would assure them, he is not. The dumb guy being secretly smarter than he lets on is a common trope, and in some ways, Brutus is more intelligent than he seems in specific skills, but he is simply not very clever. His brain looks at things as he sees it, and rarely questions the world around him unless someone else prompts him to do so first.

He's big and dumb, but he's happy, and exceptionally loyal. He would defend Clovis (or his "sister") with his life without thinking about it.

This is 1 of 2 quick sketches made for the winners of a Discord fanart contest from last year. As always, I don't organize these contests or have anything to do with the fan discords, but I was asked if I could provide sketches for the contest winners and I was happy to oblige.

title: Laura's First Console
description:
Modern AU - A young Laura discovers her first love, suggested by GiantBurger!

Not sure why I chose an SNES parody... I could have gone with something slightly more modern like an early Playstation or XBox, or tried to fabricated one entirely... but I think maybe just because it was my first console I felt like drawing something a little nostalgic for me. :) I was a 90's kid after all. I also think, on top of this sketch being set in the past, it might make sense to have the modern TK setting be slightly behind our own, technology wise, since the existence of magic might have meant less pressure to develop alternatives.

For those wondering about the prices, the Modern AU's currency (1G) is about 10 dollars. (It's actually a little more, but 10 makes it easy to just move the decimal over to the right one place and get a rough idea of the equivalent value.) I have a fondness for settings that uses smaller values for prices, so that the pennies are still useful. I just think the novelty of it is fun. :9

title: Side Comic: Pixie Panic!
description:
On the return trip from the Basitin island, the Na'Rella crosses paths with a swarm of glowing winged creatures with a penchant for magical mischief! Can the crew regain control of the ship? Read to find out!

This 24-page side comic was originally created in 2012. The art is a little dated now, but I'm happy to make it available to all Patrons. Attached is a zip file containing a pdf and a folder with all the pages. Hope you enjoy!

With any luck, this will be the first of many. I have plans to make and publish more side comics for all Patrons in the future!

title: The Mother
description:
#3 Color vote from February, suggested by Starcat13!


Deep in the forest, Laura meets Willow's "Mother" - the source of the fay.

Willow's mother was originally a beautiful young dragon, one of the very first born. As a child, she was a rambunctious risk-taker, having been told by her own mother that dragons were immortal, and thus she had nothing to fear. But one day, she became injured, and was told to be more careful. That even though dragons were biologically immortal and would never die of old age, she could be killed like any other creature.

The thought terrified the young dragoness. Not just the thought of death, but the idea that, unlike other creatures who had finite lives, when she died, she would be missing out on a potentially infinite life she could have otherwise lived, and that no matter how long she lived, it was inevitable. Death became a specter, lurking everywhere. She needed safety.

One day, she found an enormous field of black mana crystals deep in the forest. Black crystals commonly form around battlefields where many have died. She could feel their power and was sure this was the answer to her fears. She fed off of them, believing they would last her forever. And though the crystals shrunk only imperceptive, year after year, they did eventually begin to run out. By then her natural dragon magic had been entirely replaced by the substance made from souls, and she desperately needed more.

Fearing to go out herself, she used her shapeshifting in an unnatural way and split off pieces of herself to send into the world outside her forest. First to gather black mana from other battlefields and places of death. And then, when those sources became rarer, to find any people who have died recently and bring their life force back. When even that wasn't enough, in desperation, she sent her wisps to lead wandering travelers astray to their deaths. The more she split herself, the less like a dragon she became. Travelers would come to call the strange creatures the fay.

Willow was one such creature, a wisp, but became lost and eventually developed her own personality, and a fear of ever returning to her "mother" else she might consume her once more.

But you know, other than the murdering, she's pretty nice.

title: Lynx Kingdom
description:
#1 Color vote, Lt Reed infiltrating the Lynx kingdom in disguise, suggested by Even!

I enjoyed painting the background for this. The architecture is an esthetic I really enjoy, but one I've never had the opportunity to draw before. And yes, the lynx are living in a desert oasis here. When I first drew the sketch I legit just... forgot lynxes in real life are usually from high altitude forests and snowy regions. XD Maybe TK lynxes are just different, or this is an offshoot tribe. Perhaps their big paws help with the soft shifting sands and the fluffy coats are for cold desert nights instead.

title: Karen Yawns
description:
Over-dramatic yawning! Not a request, just wanted to draw Karen. I don't often get suggestions for human characters, but then again, I suppose it's my fault since Maren and Karen are the only two main human women on the cast... save of course for Raine! Who, let's be honest, is usually requested as wolf more often than not. 😏

Sketching and coloring Maren last month did get me in the mood to draw more humans, though, so this is for me to help practice branching out. And who knows? With Lt. Alice Reed (who, yes, is a woman despite the short hair!) & Seraphina's Mercs, there may be more opportunities yet in the chapters to come!

title: Magical Mishaps #1 Post-Story Discussion
description:
◄First Page ⯇Previous Page | Next Page⯈ Gallery Page► 

Dun dun duuuun...

Hello everyone! Magical Mishaps #1 is over! The next story is still in the works, so it might be a little while before we get into MM#2, especially with all the conventions coming up in July. I cannot say exactly when it will start, but I will be sure to let you know! For now, I want to give you guys an opportunity to discuss both this comic, and future upcoming comics, if you'd like, along with answering questions.

Magical Mishaps #2 will not be a sequel to MM#1. As I said before, This is an anthology of different encounters with various magical items, creatures, beasts, spells, etc. Not all Magical Mishaps stories will be full-sized like this one. I hope to do some shorter ones, in the 1 - 6 page range that cover simple, one-off mishaps.

Some stories may not involve Twokinds characters at all, but might feature new characters, monsters, and events in locations of the Twokinds world that would otherwise not be covered in the mainline series. Hopefully, you guys will still find them entertaining without most of the familiar faces!

Please, feel free to discuss what you might like to see here. I welcome hearing your thoughts. If you have comments or suggestions and would like to send them to me, you can also do so by emailing me here: stories@magicalmishaps.com (I will likely not answer most emails due to time, so don't expect it, but I will read them!)

And for the record, no, this is not normal alien behavior. DO NOT approach hostile aliens expecting affection.

title: Fennel - Character Design
description:
Character Sketch. I've shown this on stream, but figured it should be posted somewhere (and I felt bad I didn't have any other sketch ready for today yet). This is a wip design for a character in an upcoming project I've been working on for a while. It's not final, but it's close to final. I dunno if he actually is a fox or maned wolf, he's just sorta supposed to look like one.

He's a chill, laid-back kind of guy. He's got a lot of neck.

The project he's for is coming along. I hope to have more to show soon!

title: Tiger Embrace
description:
Nora Card sponsored by Azuma! Original sketch here.

Bonus Lore:

Many tigers in the tiger lands do not have dedicated bedrooms in their homes. Instead, they usually have one large room and one large, round bed in the center, low to the ground or even built into the floor. An entire family will sleep together in this communal bed.

The bed in this art is a slightly smaller version of a traditional tiger bed. A sort of hybrid between human and tiger design, raised off the ground more than a tiger's bed would be, but still round in the traditional style.

Zen and Natani, modern times, suggested by TomRedlion!


I apologize to any gun guys if you spot anything wrong. Spending so much time in a fantasy setting means I don't have much experience drawing modern stuff. Still, exploring new things is part of the fun of doing these sketch suggestions.


This was a post-stream drawing. Since we have a backlog of sketches, I decided to do some on my own time and post two a day until Sunday, so we'll be caught up for next week! :) Never thought I'd end up with TOO MANY sketches.

title: Laura Enslaved AU
description:
What If... Laura didn't escape the wolf slavers, and was instead taken and eventually sold to the Vaughan Trading Corporation, suggested by Hunter117x!

----

If this were the case, Keith would have encountered Laura quite a bit earlier, when the gang reached Eric's estate. This was just after Natani used the Heart's Desire on him, so he might think this is another Laura illusion, but after he gets she's real, there would definitely be hell to pay for Eric for buying his fiancée.

After that, I could see it going one of two ways. Laura might try to persuade Keith to continue on to the island and complete his journey anyway. In which case, things happen as usual, except Laura would be on the ship, and I suspect when Alabaster starts pushing for Keith to kill Natani (and Laura, maybe, in this timeline) Keith would likely just go, you know what, forget this, let's get out of here.

The other way would be Keith straight up saying he doesn't need the island once he's made up with Laura in Eric's estate. Either way, I feel like roads would instead lead towards coastal fox territory, or perhaps a bee-line to Edinmire.

title: Trace and Natani AU
description:
An alternate universe where Natani met Trace when he first woke up instead of Flora, suggested by Brandon Awesome!

----

The only way I can figure this working is if Flora never ran from the arranged marriage with Sythe (or there never was an arranged marriage and Flora remained with the tigers) and at some point Natani and Zen were caught by slavers and taken into human territory. Trace would wake up and bumble across Natani cornered, fighting the slavers after having escaped them, and Trace would run in and help, not understanding the situation.

Natani would be immediately aggressive towards Trace, but then realize he's an idiot and think "I could use this to get Zen back." With the mental link, Trace and Natani start trying to track Zen's location down. As they travel, Natani picks up human speech out of necessity - which he'd already started doing since being captured by humans - and in turn, Natani starts training Trace to stop him from being such a wuss in physical combat.

They stumble upon Keith like normal, since he's in the nearby town. There would be a lot of aggression here, since this is early, Keidran-hating Keith. There'd be no run-in with Euchre since there's no Flora, although Euchre would still be keeping an eye on Trace from a distance, and Nora would certainly still show up at some point. There'd also be no assassin ambush in the woods, since... that was Natani and Zen, obviously. Although there could be some other wolf attack here instead that might be interesting, what with Natani defending a human. I could imagine some moment of truth where Natani has the chance to betray Trace and almost considers it, but ultimately chooses not to, and the wolves label Natani a traitor. Keith would see Natani in a new light and start reconsidering his thoughts on Keidran.

Eventually they'd make it to the coast and it would turn out Eric's family are the one's that are housing Zen, having facilitated the slave trade. They'd break him free at night and then decide to steal Eric's ship, since they're still going along with the idea of traveling to the Basitin Island for Keith's sake, and Natani & Zen has nowhere else to go, being labeled traitors.

----

That's as far as I've thought about this. It is a shame that Flora gets written out of the story in this alternate universe, although perhaps if the arranged marriage never happened, Flora could still show up as a character when the party eventually travels into tiger territory. Which... still hasn't happened yet, but yeah, there's room for Flora to still show up.

There's even ways to have her show up earlier, if, say... there was an arranged marriage, but she only ran after arriving in wolf territory, so she'd run into the gang right before Eric's town. That might even be how the gang end up fighting wolves near the border, since they could be the ones trying to get Flora back.

title: Rose's Rescue
description:
An origin comic about the first meeting between Saria, Trace's future wife, and Rose, the cousin of Euchre. After being interrogated by then Grand Templar Mary Silverlock, Rose was kept a prisoner, and would have spent the rest of her life forgotten in a Templar dungeon.

Thankfully, Saria and a couple people inside the Templar arranged for her escape. Saria took Rose in, employing her as a servant (with pay!) until she could arrange travel back to wolf lands. Rose however, extremely grateful towards Saria, eventually decided she had nothing to go back to, and chose to stay.

Saria and Rose remained extremely close. Saria years later would marry Trace, ironically resulting in Rose once again ending up in Grand Templar hands after Trace took power.

This backstory comic was sketches many years ago, and finally brought to life by iliar with the creative use of a Nora Card! Thank you, iliar for helping to get this page made!

title: Unspoken Friendship
description:
Mike and Evals meet for the first time, suggested by Menke.

 

Mike was born into slavery. Evals was captured. As a dog, Evals had been raised to believe that foxes weren't to be trusted, as there's a lot of hatred between fox and dog keidran in the wild. But at this point he didn't have much else to lose. Both would later go on to be sold to Eric's father as ship hands, and later inherited by Eric himself.

title: Morlin Hall
description:
The Human Empire's relatively humble capitol city, suggested by Van Korben! It's huge castle sits atop one of the only large hills in an otherwise flat region of land surrounded by fields and forests. Farms and smaller outlying villages dot the landscape, extending for miles in all directions to provide food for the city center.

The city gets its name from the castle itself. There was originally another older Morlin castle which was completely destroyed during the first Keidran war. This castle was given the name in tribute, and is relatively new.

title: Templar Organization
description:
A chart showing the basics of the Templar hierarchy, suggested by SpillTheFire6!

History:

The Templar started out as a tiny guild, funded by one well-connected individual (who I haven't had time to flesh out yet). They only really rose to prominence during the first war against the Keidran hundreds of years prior to the start of the comic. A war which the human race was losing ground due to the overwhelming Keidran numbers until the Templar helped turn the tide. This made them very popular among the human populace, who saw them as noble protectors rather than the zealots they'd eventually become.

Basic Hierarchy:

The Grand Templar sits at the top and controls the overall direction of the guild. The Master Templars act as his inner circle, basically a board of directors. They have areas they focus on, but there's a lot of overlap. They delegate tasks to the High Templars, who are the senior commanders of the various Templar Corps. From there it splinters off into more specific roles and ranks, depending on the corps, going from Mages and Knights all the way down to Initiates.

The Templar have a lot of "off the books" R&D and secret employees who aren't technically part of the organization, and there's a lot of infighting among the ranks regarding which department should control what and who should be at the top.

Ever since Trace's coup and eventual disappearance, many Templar feel like the guild has become a ship without a rudder, with leaders preoccupied with their own agendas rather than the betterment of the guild as a whole.

----

This took a lot of time and research, since the inner workings of the Templar is not something I had fully fleshed out in my personal notes. Keep in mind, I am not actually the manager of an evil organization in real life, so if there's any gaps or issues regarding how a large company would really be run, I apologize! Feel free to share your own input if you have some expertise, I'd love to hear your thoughts.

title: Magical Mishaps - Story 1 Page 1
description:
◄First Page ⯇Previous Page | Next Page⯈ Gallery Page► 

And so our story begins! This is my first time trying anything like this, so please bear with me if there's any issues starting out.

These side comics are unrelated to the current events happening in the mainline comic, and take place at a different time. Some may not have anything to do with the Twokinds cast or setting at all, and instead feature something completely new.

Hope you enjoy!

Note: This comic is mirrored on my Deviantart:

https://www.deviantart.com/twokinds/gallery/77555987/the-collar

title: Magical Mishaps
description:
Presenting a new sketch comic series! Magical Mishaps will be an anthology of short stories, mostly themed around magic and its potential to go wrong. The first story will start Dec 19th and update here on Patreon every Wednesday.

Like other side comics, this is a reward for Patrons! If you want to keep up with the pages as they are being posted, consider becoming one if you aren't already. That said, the first few pages of each story will release for non-patrons later, for those on the fence, so you can get a sneak peek of what it's about! ;)

Some of the stories do get a little saucy... in a lighthearted way. I hope you'll enjoy them!

Tiger-form Trace and Flora share a tender moment together during a rain shower, color sponsored by Azuma! This is the final Nora Card for the month. Thank you so much for the support!

I love these color suggestions for giving me the opportunity to work with so many different environments and moods. From futuristic tech to nighttime snowfalls and sunny overcast rain showers. It's been a great learning experience. Thank you again to all the sponsors this month, iliar, Marshallmelon, amenon, and Azuma.

Rose as Red, from the game Transistor, which is really great, btw! Suggested by TaboaConstrictR originally, and color sponsored by Marshallmelon thanks to his use of a Nora card! Thank you very much for supporting Twokinds and making more art possible.


Believe it or not, the Transistor 'sword' took almost as long as the rest of the image by itself.

description:

title: Basitin Bath
description: Scrub-a-dub-dub, Keith in a tub. Laura gives Keith a bath shortly after he washes up on shore, because surprisingly, being adrift at sea surrounded by water still makes you pretty filthy after a few weeks. Keith meanwhile is getting a bit of a culture shock, as fox Keidran have no qualms bathing outside with mixed gender company, but Basitins certainly do. Suggested by Mandag!

title: Expulsion
description:
The story of how the Red-Haired Guy got expelled from the Templar!

title: Merchant Magpie
description:
( Magpie was a character concept from a story I was working on many years ago that's currently on the back-burner right now. )

Magpie is a descendant of Basitins exiled from the empire. She makes a living as a traveling merchant, trading in anything she can get her paint-covered hands on. Being raised around a mixture of Humans and Keidran, she doesn't have any of the cultural traits typical of a Basitin, save for those that are instinctual. What she loves most in life is MONEY! Suggested by Kinipshun!

title: Proto-Flora
description:
Flora's original design, suggested by Orekh!

Before Twokinds, there was a black and white cat named Kaylia. She went through several designs and iterations, until eventually Twokinds began. The name became Flora, but for the first couple pages, she was still just a house cat. However, by coincidence, Halloween happened to fall a few days after the comic began, and I decided to try coloring Flora as a tiger. It was one of the first times she was ever in color, and what started as just a Halloween costume instantly became Flora's actual design. I'd later go back and retroactively change her to a tiger in the first couple pages (which were black and white anyway).

In the comic before Twokinds, the main character was actually Raine! Raine and Kaylia were good friends / rivals in the series, which is funny, because in Twokinds, Raine and Flora have practically zero interaction with each other. Strange how things end up.

title: Side Comic: The Dragon Masquerade
description:
A prequel story! 6 months after Zen linked minds with Natani, the siblings are now paying off the debt for that life-saving procedure by performing a heist for Clovis, the self-coined "Prince of Greed". Little do they know who they're actually stealing from...


 This 24-page side comic was originally created in 2014 and is now being made available digitally for the first time to all patrons! I hope you enjoy the story, it was a lot of work at the time of making it.


If you enjoy these side comics, I will begin creating new ones to be published for patrons in the future. Please let me know.

title: Maren and Karen Ref Sheet
description:
All you need to know about the tavern sisters, Maren and Karen, suggested by Mediawatcher!

Fun extra fact: Maren and Karen were the 3rd and 4th characters I designed, right after Keith (#1) and Raine (#2), and before even Trace and Flora. In the beginning, they were going to have elf-like ears. The fact that they were elves really didn't have any baring on the story at all, and I decided I didn't want to muddle things, so I took elves out altogether and made them human.

Karen is often depicted with two sets of ears, but I've been drawing the human ears less and less, since it is a bit weird when I think about it. XD

title: Good Morning Willow
description:
Spooky but cute Willow Wisp suggested by Scruffuls!


For those out of the loop, Willow is an old character design I made many years ago for a comic that I've unfortunately never found the time to make, at least as of yet. Her body is that of a lioness, but her true form is the floating blue spirit, which she usually carries around in her lantern.
Willow can detach herself from her body and move around in sprite form, as seen here. Her body will continue to act on autopilot (albeit a little stupidly) while she's away, but she can't stay removed for too long or her body will slowly start developing its own personality, in much the same way that Willow once did long ago when she herself split off from a larger, much more powerful creature deep in the forest, who she calls "mother".


For more see previous sketch here, and color version here.

title: Kathrin's Introduction
description:
Now in color, thanks to our Nora Card sponsor Azuma!

This is a remake of page 274, drawn as if it were made today! I had a lot of fun revising this scene. I wouldn't mind revisiting more scenes from the past - though a whole page is perhaps a little too much. XD It's a lot of work.

I still think the original page has its own charm - something that's not entirely possible to completely recapture. It's a nostalgic snapshot in time, and I don't blame anyone if they say they prefer the simpler style. ^^ Still, I hope you appreciate seeing a more modern take on Kat's first appearance.

Original sketch suggested by SomeOtherTom!
